en: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, So honor is not seemly for a fool.
hmr: Nipui laia vûr le, busîk huna ruo ân hmê naw angin, Inzâkaina hi invêt ta ding chun a âwm nawh.

en: As the sparrow in her wandering, as the swallow in her flying, So the curse that is causeless alighteth not.
hmr: Chawngzawng ân vâk ân vâk ang le, peleu a vuong lai angin, A san boa ṭawngse inphurna chu a fu ngai nawh.

en: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, And a rod for the back of fools.
hmr: Vuokna hruihruol chu sakawr ta ding a na, thîrse chu sabengtung ta ding, Chun, hmawl chu mi invêthai ruongzâng ta ding a nih.

en: Answer not a fool according to his folly, Lest thou also be like unto him.
hmr: Mi invêt chu ân vêtzie ang peiin dawn naw rawh, Chuong naw chun, ama ang hung ni rawi i tih.

en: Answer a fool according to his folly, Lest he be wise in his own conceit.
hmr: Mi invêt chu ân vêtzie ang peiin dawn rawh, Chuong naw chun, ama le ama mi varah insie hlau rawi a tih.

en: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool Cutteth off his own feet, and drinketh in damage.
hmr: Mi invêt kuta thucha thawntu chun, Ama kehai ngei chu a sât bawngin, sietna chu a dâwn a nih.

en: The legs of the lame hang loose; So is a parable in the mouth of fools.
hmr: Mi silbai kehai chu sawr thei loin ân khai zawi a, Chuong ang bawkin, invêthai baua chun tekhithu chu a nih.

en: As one that bindeth a stone in a sling, So is he that giveth honor to a fool.
hmr: Mi invêt kuoma inzâkaina petu chu, Lung inthuo kâra lunghlu ip ang a nih.

en: As a thorn that goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, So is a parable in the mouth of fools.
hmr: Mi invêthai baua tekhithu chu, Zu inrui kuta hling lût ang el hi a nih.

en: As an archer that woundeth all, So is he that hireth a fool and he that hireth them that pass by.
hmr: Mi inlawn mei meihai ruoitu le, mi invêt ruoitu chu, Thal kâptu mi po po sukhliemtu ang chu a nih.

en: As a dog that returneth to his vomit, So is a fool that repeateth his folly.
hmr: Mi invêt ân vêtna thu hril hriltu chu, Ui ama luok bawka kîr nâwk ang chu a nih.

en: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? There is more hope of a fool than of him.
hmr: Mi ama ngaidân chaua var chu i hmu hlak am? Ama nêk chun mi invêta chun beiseina lien lem a um.

en: The sluggard saith, There is a lion in the way; A lion is in the streets.
hmr: Mi thabo chun, “Sakeibaknei chu lampuiah a um a, Sakeibaknei chu kawtthlêrahai a um,” a ti hlak.

en: As the door turneth upon its hinges, So doth the sluggard upon his bed.
hmr: Kawtkhâr chu ân khainaa ân her ân her hlak angin, Mi thabo chun chuong ang bawk chun a khum chungah a thaw.

en: The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish; It wearieth him to bring it again to his mouth.
hmr: Mi thabo chun thlênga chun a kut chu a phûm a, A baua hang thun nâwk ding takngiel khawm chu a lungngai hlak.

en: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit Than seven men that can render a reason.
hmr: Mi pasari a san pe theituhai nêk chun, Mi thabo chu ama ngairuotna kawnga chun a var lem.

en: He that passeth by, and vexeth himself with strife belonging not to him, Is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.
hmr: Mi hung inlawn a, ama ṭhang- na ni hlek si lo inhalnaa vân suklungsen chu, Ui lâwnlai a nakâwrhaia mantu ang chu a nih.

en: As a madman who casteth firebrands, Arrows, and death,
hmr: Mi invêt thingthuhringhai, Thalhai le thina petu ang chu,

en: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbor, And saith, Am not I in sport?
hmr: Mi a tuolbâwm hlêma, “Ka fiemthu mei mei an nawm ie!” titu chu a nih.

en: For lack of wood the fire goeth out; And where there is no whisperer, contention ceaseth.
hmr: Thingthu tlâksam leiin mei chu a rêm a, Chun, milâwt hmang um nawnaa chun inkhingna a re.

en: As coals are to hot embers, and wood to fire, So is a contentious man to inflame strife.
hmr: Meihawlhai chu meiling ding le, thinghai chu mei ding an ni angin, Mi hrângsie chu inkhingna sukṭaltu a nih.

en: The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels, And they go down into the innermost parts.
hmr: Milâwtthiem thuhai chu bubâr tuihnâitak ang an na, Phîngsûng hmun inriltakhaia chun an fe thla.

en: Fervent lips and a wicked heart Are like an earthen vessel overlaid with silver dross.
hmr: Hmûr zumlezuor intuo le lungril suol chu, Pil bêl rângkachak êka inluon ang a nih.

en: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips; But he layeth up deceit within him:
hmr: Theidatu chun a hmûrhai chun ân tlip a, Amiruokchu, ama sûnga chun hmusitna a siekhâwl.

en: When he speaketh fair, believe him not; For there are seven abominations in his heart:
hmr: Thu a hril ṭha hle khawm a, ama chu ring naw la, A lungrila chun tirdakumna pasari a um sih a.

en: Though his hatred cover itself with guile, His wickedness shall be openly showed before the assembly.
hmr: A theidana chu ama le ama vervêknain inkhum sien khawm, A suolna chu mipui hmaa phuongphotaka inentir nîng a tih.

en: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein; And he that rolleth a stone, it shall return upon him.
hmr: Tukhawm hnuoikhur cho taphawt chu chutaka chun tlâng an ta, Tukhawm lung inhlum taphawt chu, ama chungah hung kîr a tih.

en: A lying tongue hateth those whom it hath wounded; And a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
hmr: Lei khêlinhlip chun a înhliem tahai chu a theidah a, Inpâk derna bau chun sietna sin a thaw.
